qas.question: In what kind of area did forest gardening start?
In what other types of areas did forest gardening show up?
What kind of plant did these early gardeners seek out?
What use did forest gardeners put to tree and vines to?
What did these gardeners do about unwanted species?
What type of gardens originated in modern times?
What type of gardens were located in the dry foothills of monsoon regions?
Inferior foreign species were selected and incorporated where?
What was being used as a food production system in all parts of the world?
When families were trying to ruin their immediate environment, undesirable species were what?

context: <b8_0>Forest gardening<b8_0/> was also being used as a food production system in various parts of the world over this period. <b5_0><b6_0>Forest gardens<b6_0/><b5_0/> originated in prehistoric times along <a0_0>jungle-clad river banks<a0_0/> and in the wet <a1_0>foothills of monsoon regions<a1_0/>.[citation needed] In the gradual process of families improving their immediate environment, useful <a2_0>tree and vine species<a2_0/> were <a3_0>identified, protected and improved<a3_0/>, whilst undesirable species were <a4_0><b9_0>eliminated<b9_0/><a4_0/>. Eventually superior foreign species were selected and incorporated <b7_0>into the gardens<b7_0/>.
